sen.j: 石田散薬（いしださんやく）とは新選組の副長、土方歳三の生家が製造、販売していた薬。
sen.e: The Ishida Sanyaku was medical powder made and sold by a home of Toshizo HIJIKATA, a vice chief of the Shinsengumi (a paramilitary group of pro-shogunate ronin formed in Kyoto).
Ishida Sanyaku was medical powder made and sold by the home of the parents of Toshizo HIJIKATA, a vice chief of the Shinsengumi (a paramilitary group of pro-shogunate ronin formed in Kyoto).
sen.cmt: ・Ishida Sanyakuは固有名詞のため定冠詞は不要と思われます。・a homeだけでは生家と限定されないため、the home of the parents of～としました。
sen.e: Ishida Sanyaku was medical powder made and sold by the home of the parents of Toshizo HIJIKATA, a vice chief of the Shinsengumi (a paramilitary group of pro-shogunate ronin formed in Kyoto).

sen.j: 接骨や打ち身、捻挫、筋肉痛、また切り傷等に効用があるとされていた。
sen.e: The powder was considered to work for bonesetting, bruise, muscle pain, and cut.
sen.cmt: 主語として 'powder' を補いました。
sen.e: The powder was considered to work for bonesetting, bruise, muscle pain, and cut.
The powder was considered to work for bonesetting, bruise, muscle pain, and cut.

sen.j: 河童明神から製造方法を教わったという伝説がある。
sen.e: There was a legend that a Kappa Myojin (a deity of Kappa, an imaginary creature) taught them the production method.
There is a legend that a Kappa Myojin (a deity of Kappa, an imaginary creature) taught them the production method.
sen.cmt: 伝説は今も残っているのでthere isが良いと思います。
sen.e: There is a legend that a Kappa Myojin (a deity of Kappa, an imaginary creature) taught them the production method.

tit.cmt: rawは余分なニュアンスが入るため不要と思われます。

sen.j: 土方家のすぐ近くにある、多摩川の支流の淺川（浅川 (東京都)）に生えている牛革草（ぎゅうかくそう、ミゾソバのこと）を原材料にしている。
sen.e: 'Gyukakuso' (a plant of a buckwheat family, scientific name: Polygonum Thunbergii) that had been grown along the area of the Asakawa river, which was a tributary of the Tamagawa river, near the Hijikata's house, was its raw material.

Gyukakuso' (a plant of a buckwheat family, scientific name: Polygonum Thunbergii) that had been grown along the area of the Asakawa river, which was a tributary of the Tamagawa river, near Hijikata's house, was its raw material.
sen.cmt: ・文頭の余分なスペースを削除しました。・near the Hijikata'sのtheは不要と思われます。
sen.e: Gyukakuso' (a plant of a buckwheat family, scientific name: Polygonum Thunbergii) that had been grown along the area of the Asakawa river, which was a tributary of the Tamagawa river, near Hijikata's house, was its raw material.

sen.j: 刈り取り時期は土用の丑の日限定である。
sen.e: It was harvested only on the Midsummer Day of the Ox, (that falls sometime in late July or early August, traditionally considered the hottest period of the year).
It was harvested only on the Midsummer Day of the Ox (that falls sometime in late July or early August, traditionally considered the hottest period of the year).
sen.cmt: Oxは文末のためコンマは不要と思われます。
sen.e: It was harvested only on the Midsummer Day of the Ox (that falls sometime in late July or early August, traditionally considered the hottest period of the year).
The production method
Production method
sen.cmt: 項目タイトルなので冠詞は不要と思われます。
sen.e: Production method

sen.j: 刈り取った牛革草を天日で乾燥させ、目方を十分の一になるまでにする。
sen.e: Reduce the waight of the harvested Gyukakuso to one tenth by sun-drying.
Harvested Gyukakuso is dried under the sun to reduce the weight to one tenth.
sen.cmt: 手順書ではないため、命令形は不自然と思われます。
sen.e: Harvested Gyukakuso is dried under the sun to reduce the weight to one tenth.

sen.j: そして、乾燥した牛革草を黒焼きにして鉄鍋に入れる。
sen.e: Then, char the dried Gyukakuso and put it in the iron pan.
The dried Gyukakuso is charred and put into an iron pan.
sen.cmt: 手順書ではないため、命令形は不自然と思われます。
sen.e: The dried Gyukakuso is charred and put into an iron pan.

sen.j: その後、酒を散布して、再び乾燥させる。
sen.e: And, after sprinkling sake over the Gyukakuso, wither it again.
Sake is sprinkled over the Gyukakuso and it is dried again.
sen.cmt: 手順書ではないため、命令形は不自然と思われます。
sen.e: Sake is sprinkled over the Gyukakuso and it is dried again.

sen.j: 最後に、薬研にかけて粉末にすれば完成。
sen.e: Last of all, with a yagen (a tool used to grind Chinese medicine), reduce it to a complete powder.
Lastly, it is powered with a yagen (a tool used to grind Chinese medicine).
sen.cmt: 手順書ではないため、命令形は不自然と思われます。
sen.e: Lastly, it is powered with a yagen (a tool used to grind Chinese medicine).

sen.j: 石田散薬の服用法は特異なものである。
sen.e: Ishida Sanyak had a unique dose method.
Ishida Sanyaku had a unique dose method.
sen.cmt: Sanyak→Sanyakuのスペルミスのようです。
sen.e: Ishida Sanyaku had a unique dose method.

sen.j: それは水ではなく熱燗の日本酒で飲むようにされている。
sen.e: Instead of water, the medicene should be taken with warmed Japanese sake.
The medicine should be taken with warmed Japanese sake, instead of water.
sen.cmt: Instead ofが並ぶ対象が不明なため、最後に持ってきて明確にしました。・medicene→medicineのスペルミスのようです。
sen.e: The medicine should be taken with warmed Japanese sake, instead of water.

sen.j: 服用量は一服、あるいは一日量、一匁（3.75グラム）とされている。
sen.e: The dosage was instructed as 3.75g a dose, or a day.
The dosage was specified as 3.75g a dose, or a day.
sen.cmt: instructの目的語はinstructする相手であるべきなので、specifyに変えました。
sen.e: The dosage was specified as 3.75g a dose, or a day.

sen.j: 本当に薬効があったかは疑わしく、1948年（昭和23年）薬事法改正に伴う製造販売許可申請において、厚生省は「成分本質効能に関する客観性のある科学的調査研究がなされていない」として石田散薬に限らず、黒焼き全ての薬効を認めないという方針を示した。
sen.e: In 1948, in response to its manufacturing license application with the enforcement of amendments to the Pharmaceutical Affairs Law, the Ministry of Health and Welfare concluded that all charred medicines, including the Ishida Sanyaku, didn't meet government criteria for efficacy, saying 'any clinical, scientific researches into their components, quolities and efficacys had not been carried out'.

In 1948, in response to its manufacturing license application with the enforcement of amendments to the Pharmaceutical Affairs Law, the Ministry of Health and Welfare concluded that all charred medicines, including the Ishida Sanyaku, did not meet government criteria for efficacy, saying 'any clinical, scientific researches into their components, qualities and efficacy have not been carried out.'
sen.cmt: ・efficacyはここでは不可算名詞のため修正しました。・quolities→qualitiesのスペルミスのようです。・had not beenはここでは直接話法ですので、時制の一致は不要と思われます。・統一事項に従ってピリオドはクォーテーションマークの中に入れました。・didn'tは口語のため、did notとしました。
sen.e: In 1948, in response to its manufacturing license application with the enforcement of amendments to the Pharmaceutical Affairs Law, the Ministry of Health and Welfare concluded that all charred medicines, including the Ishida Sanyaku, did not meet government criteria for efficacy, saying 'any clinical, scientific researches into their components, qualities and efficacy have not been carried out.'

sen.j: しかし、「石田散薬しか飲まない」と言って聞かなかった老人もいた。
sen.e: On the other hand, there was an old man who insisted that he would never take any medicine but Ishida Sanyaku.
sen.cmt: ・thereの前の余分なスペースを削除しました。・a old man→an old manが正です。
sen.e: On the other hand, there was an old man who insisted that he would never take any medicine but Ishida Sanyaku.

sen.j: 今でも土方歳三資料館には製造中止した頃の石田散薬が僅かに残っている。
sen.e: The Tosizo HIJIKATA museum still has a little Ishida Sanyaku at the time of discontinuation of manufacturing.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Tosizo HIJIKATA museum still has a little Ishida Sanyaku at the time of discontinuation of manufacturing.
The Tosizo HIJIKATA museum still has a little Ishida Sanyaku at the time of discontinuation of manufacturing.

sen.j: 土方家の人は「古く怖くて飲めない」と言っている。
sen.e: People of the Hijikatas say, 'it's too old, too scary to take this medicine'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: People of the Hijikatas say, 'it's too old, too scary to take this medicine.'
sen.cmt: ・統一事項に従ってピリオドはクォーテーションマークの中に入れました。
sen.e: People of the Hijikatas say, 'it's too old, too scary to take this medicine.'

sen.j: また、牛革草自体はリューマチ、止血、鎮痛に効果のあるれっきとした薬草である。
sen.e: Gyukakuso itself is a herbal medicine that works for rheumatism, hemostatic, and pain relief.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Gyukakuso itself is a herbal medicine that works for rheumatism, hemostatic, and pain relief.
Gyukakuso itself is a herbal medicine that works for rheumatism, hemostatic, and pain relief.

sen.j: しかし、石田散薬は黒焼きにしたため薬効が台無しになってしまったと考えられる。
sen.e: However, when it was charred for Ishida Sanyaku, such efficacy was considered to get ruined.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, when it was charred for Ishida Sanyaku, such efficacy was considered to become ruined.
sen.cmt: getは口語のためbecomeに変更しました。
sen.e: However, when it was charred for Ishida Sanyaku, such efficacy was considered to become ruined.
